title.label: Play it with Apple Pencil on iPad is fun!

I had this game for sometime but playing with finger restricted my advance in the game. 

Now with Apple Pencil, I have take this into a whole new level and is so much fun now as using a Pencil is sooooooo much faster.  OMG!!! Go try it yourself! Use a Apple Pencil on this game!

some of the symbols don't register. the backwards threes, the loop spells, sometimes the simple v's or ^'s don't either. this is the first game in the last year that has captivated me because of the variety and design, and I really want to love this game with all of my heart, but when I'm in my focused state and something won't work, then it's not a good feeling. also, maybe let the spells come up more often in the original gameplay, I need all the help I can get when I'm overloaded with 6+ symbols. all in all, though, this game is pretty good.
The second I started playing I had to put it down it was so boring!

title.label: Simple, But Addictive and Never Boring -- One of the Best Games on App Store

content.label:
A wonderful infinite scroller that stays addictive, but never frustrating, and simple, but never boring or repetitive. A satisfying game as well.
I've always been a fan of Nitrome, and this game showcases all the ingenuity I've come to expect from them. This is easily one of the best games in the app store.

Very original and fun

Magic Touch is a very simple pick up and play game. All you have to do is swipe in the patterns to make your wizard pop the balloons carrying enemy troops. Of course, just because it's simple doesn't mean it's easy!

There are four play modes, including Arcade modes three, Classic, Zen, where you'll only need to swipe against the basic patters--none of those more complicated purple ones--and a hard mode, if you're really up to the challenge (I haven't been), and a Time Attack mode, which is really quite fun. 

The game is just as fun as I remember it being when I first played it around 2 years ago. Helps it has such charming art style and animations, and a variety of power ups to work for to unlock. 

The only negative I have is doing those open circle patterns have always been a pain! It's too easy to make it read as a 'V' instead, which can ruin a good run. Although that can be annoying, that's my only problem with the game, I'd recommend it.
Very, very good game. Highly recommend üëåüèªüëåüèªüëåüèª

This game is a lot of fun, but you get 2 stars for having one of the 3 game modes basically unplayable. On insane, the reverse 3 never registers, even if I take my time to draw a perfect one. I get its complex, but that thing seriously is a luck of the draw on if it works. Can't get more than 10 on insane because when it pops up, that's usually game over. Fix that, please! I don't really have much else to gripe about. But losing an entire mode due to a poor shape registry is quite a fault.
